Package com.microsoft.azure.eventprocessorhost

Interface ILeaseManager

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    InMemoryLeaseManager

    public interface ILeaseManager
    If you wish to have EventProcessorHost store leases somewhere other than Azure Storage, you can write your own lease manager using this interface. The Azure Storage managers use the same storage for both lease and checkpoints, so both interfaces are implemented by the same class. You are free to do the same thing if you have a unified store for both types of data. This interface does not specify initialization methods because we have no way of knowing what information your implementation will require.

    • Method Detail

      • getLeaseRenewIntervalInMilliseconds

        int getLeaseRenewIntervalInMilliseconds​()
        Allows a lease manager implementation to specify to PartitionManager how often it should scan leases and renew them. In order to redistribute leases in a timely fashion after a host ceases operating, we recommend a relatively short interval, such as ten seconds. Obviously it should be less than half of the lease length, to prevent accidental expiration.
        Returns:
        The sleep interval between scans, specified in milliseconds.

      • getLeaseDurationInMilliseconds

        int getLeaseDurationInMilliseconds​()
        Mostly useful for testing.
        Returns:
        Duration of a lease before it expires unless renewed.

      • leaseStoreExists

        java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture<java.lang.Boolean> leaseStoreExists​()
        Does the lease store exist?
        Returns:
        true if it does, false if not
        Throws:
        com.microsoft.azure.eventprocessorhost.ExceptionWithAction - with action EventProcessorHostActionStrings.CHECKING_LEASE_STORE on error

      • createLeaseStoreIfNotExists

        java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture<java.lang.Void> createLeaseStoreIfNotExists​()
        Create the lease store if it does not exist, do nothing if it does exist.
        Returns:
        Void
        Throws:
        com.microsoft.azure.eventprocessorhost.ExceptionWithAction - with action EventProcessorHostActionStrings.CREATING_LEASE_STORE on error

      • deleteLeaseStore

        java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture<java.lang.Boolean> deleteLeaseStore​()
        Not used by EventProcessorHost, but a convenient function to have for testing.
        Returns:
        true if the lease store was deleted successfully, false if not

      • getAllLeases

        java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture<java.util.List<Lease>> getAllLeases​()
        Return the lease info for all partitions. A typical implementation could just call getLease() on all partitions.
        Returns:
        List of lease info.

      • createLeaseIfNotExists

        java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture<Lease> createLeaseIfNotExists​(java.lang.String partitionId)
        Create in the store the lease info for the given partition, if it does not exist. Do nothing if it does exist in the store already.
        Parameters:
        partitionId - id of partition to create lease info for
        Returns:
        the existing or newly-created lease info for the partition
        Throws:
        com.microsoft.azure.eventprocessorhost.ExceptionWithAction - with action EventProcessorHostActionString.CREATING_LEASE on error

      • deleteLease

        java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture<java.lang.Void> deleteLease​(Lease lease)
        Delete the lease info for the given partition from the store. If there is no stored lease for the given partition, that is treated as success.
        Parameters:
        lease - Lease info for the desired partition as previously obtained from getLease()
        Returns:
        void
        Throws:
        com.microsoft.azure.eventprocessorhost.ExceptionWithAction - with action EventProcessorHostActionString.DELETING_LEASE on error

      • acquireLease

        java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture<java.lang.Boolean> acquireLease​(Lease lease)
        Acquire the lease on the desired partition for this EventProcessorHost. Note that it is legal to acquire a lease that is already owned by another host. Lease-stealing is how partitions are redistributed when additional hosts are started.
        Parameters:
        lease - Lease info for the desired partition as previously obtained from getLease()
        Returns:
        true if the lease was acquired successfully, false if it failed because another host acquired it.
        Throws:
        com.microsoft.azure.eventprocessorhost.ExceptionWithAction - with action EventProcessorHostActionStrings.ACQUIRING_LEASE on error

      • renewLease

        java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture<java.lang.Boolean> renewLease​(Lease lease)
        Renew a lease currently held by this host. If the lease has been taken by another host (either stolen or after expiration) or explicitly released, it is not possible to renew it. You will have to call getLease() and then acquireLease() again. With the Azure Storage-based default implementation, it IS possible to renew an expired lease (that has not been taken by another host), so other implementations can allow that.
        Parameters:
        lease - Lease to be renewed
        Returns:
        true if the lease was renewed, false if the lease was lost and could not renewed
        Throws:
        com.microsoft.azure.eventprocessorhost.ExceptionWithAction - with action EventProcessorHostActionString.RENEWING_LEASE on error

      • releaseLease

        java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture<java.lang.Void> releaseLease​(Lease lease)
        Give up a lease currently held by this host. If the lease has expired or been taken by another host, releasing it is unnecessary, and will fail if attempted.
        Parameters:
        lease - Lease to be given up
        Returns:
        CompletableFuture

      • updateLease

        java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture<java.lang.Boolean> updateLease​(Lease lease)
        Update the store with the information in the provided lease. It is necessary to currently hold a lease in order to update it. If the lease has been stolen, or expired, or released, it cannot be updated. Updating should renew the lease before performing the update to avoid lease expiration during the process.
        Parameters:
        lease - New lease info to be stored
        Returns:
        true if the updated was performed successfully, false if lease was lost and could not be updated
        Throws:
        com.microsoft.azure.eventprocessorhost.ExceptionWithAction - with action EventProcessorHostActionStrings.UPDATING_LEASE on error
